m:properties.d:SpeakerDescription: Mark is an independent consultant specializing in the analysis, reporting and visualization of financial data. Over the last 20 years, he worked on many systems to measure and monitor financial performance and manage market risks that arise from banking and trading activities. He is the organizer of the London Business Analytics Group, a popular community group that holds monthly talks on topics ranging from Predictive Analytics to Power Query to Personalized Medicine. He blogs at zomalex.co.uk

Julie Hyman is a Sr. Product Manager for Quest Software. With 20+ years of experience in Development, Project Management and Product Management, Julie currently manages Toad Solutions, including Toad Data Point, Toad Intelligence Central and the new Toad Edge, among others.

Craig leads client engagement and the development of novel solutions at Enigma, a data intelligence company that has built the world's largest repository of public data, and works with Fortune 500 organizations like Merck, American Express and EMD. Working across a diverse range of industries, Craig is an expert at understanding client pain-points and delivering high impact solutions. Prior to Enigma, Craig was an engineering consultant at Buro Happold, where he focused on using data to design and model global architecture projects from museums to stadiums. He has also spent time designing energy solutions for emerging markets. Craig holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and BS in Electrical Engineering from Columbia University.

Justin leads product marketing at MapD, looking after competitive positioning, product messaging, customer stories and a wide array marketing content for sales enablement, field events, digital demand-generation, as well as public and analyst relations. Justin has led product marketing and product management programs at both small tech start-ups and mature public companies, including Symantec and Wells Fargo. He came to MapD from Hortonworks, where he created product marketing programs that positioned the company as the leader in open-source connected data platforms, and helped to grow Hortonworks from less than 10 subscribers when he joined, to an IPO and one thousand enterprise customers, including more than half of the US Fortune 100. Justin holds an MBA from UC Berkeley and a BA in International Relations from Stanford.

Dr. Andrew Banasiewicz is the Director of the Data Science & Business Analytics programs at Merrimack College and the Principal of Erudite Analytics, an analytical research consultancy focused on risk assessment. A career researcher and data scientist, he has more than two decades of applied industry experience having served as SVP of analytics at a risk management organization, VP of strategy and analytics at a marketing services firm, and Director of data science at a major insurance organization. Dr. Banasiewicz also serves as a Professor at Hult International Business School, and was formerly an Associate Professor at Boston University, and a lecturer at Harvard University and Providence College. He is the author of four books and numerous articles, a frequent speaker at international conferences in Europe, Asia and Australia, and a fellow of the Center for Evidence-Based Management, Australian Academy of Business Leadership and the Society of Risk Management Consultants, as well as a member of numerous other professional organizations. He holds Ph.D. in business from Louisiana State University.
